intro: Fagara leiorhachia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fagara, is a member of the Rutaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in axillary inflorescences, often with a subtle fragrance. The fruit is a small, berry-like drupe that contains several seeds, contributing to its ecological role in seed dispersal.
